title: Two days in the office and five days at home: could you do the 5:2 commuting diet?
text:
You’ve probably heard about the 5:2 approach to dieting – five days of normality, then two days of semi-fasting. But what about taking this balanced approach to food, and applying it to the way you live?

Take Ronnie Taylor, an actuary who divides his week between living in Edinburgh (five days) and London (two). “Personally I get bored if I’m in the same location the whole time so I love mixing things up,” he says. “The buzz of networking with clients in the City in one place, then back to Scotland for a calmer time of family and golf. It’s really the best of both worlds, though it does entail having to buy two sets of everything.”

He admits this is something of a first-world problem. But for...
